translation.en: [Dineo] Tumi. Tumi. Boitumelo!
[Dineo] [in Sesotho] Tumi, you're going to drown!
translation.ja: 〈トゥミ！〉 〈あなた 溺れるわ〉

translation.en: -[Vusi] No, we're not calling the police. -[Dineo] [in Sesotho] Tumi, you're naked.
translation.ja: 警察は呼ぶな 〈素っ裸よ〉

translation.en: [Vusi] What if those vultures in the media find out?
[in Zulu] We need to take her to the hospital.
[Grace] I'm sure there's a perfectly logical explanation to all of this.
translation.ja: 何か理由があるはずよ

translation.en: -[Lydia] Oh, my goodness! -[Sbu] Relax, relax.
translation.ja: 大変！ もう いいから

translation.en: [Tumi] I swear this is not what it looks like. -[sheep bleats] -[opening music playing]
translation.ja: みんな 誤解しないで

translation.en: ♪ Wherever there's fun That's where you'll find me ♪
translation.ja: NETFLIX オリジナルシリーズ

translation.en: ♪ Wherever there's fun That's where you'll find me ♪
[pilot] Good morning, ladies and gents. This is your captain speaking.
translation.ja: 当機へようこそ 機長でございます

translation.en: Welcome to our flight AB2709 from Cape Town to Johannesburg.
translation.ja: ケープタウンからヨハネスブルクへ向かいます

translation.en: We're expecting some turbulence this morning,
translation.ja: 乱気流が予想されますので

translation.en: so please keep your seatbelts fastened while the seatbelt lights are on.
translation.ja: シートベルトのサインが点滅しましたら…

translation.en: [Tumi] This is the image of three idiots who forgot to check in online.
translation.ja: チェックインが遅くてひどい席だ

translation.en: -Are you okay, baby? -Mm-hmm.
[Tumi] She isn't.
You know I'd be holding your hand right now if I was sitting next to you.
translation.ja: すぐ手を握ってあげる 隣に座れたら

translation.en: [Tumi] Please, don't.
Would you two like to sit together?
-Oh, no, we’re fine. -If you wouldn't mind.
translation.ja: いいえ 悪いわ 助かるよ

translation.en: We don't wanna inconvenience you.
Oh, I like the window.
[Tumi] Of course you do.
[man] Yeah.
-Sorry. There we go. -[Tumi moans]
-[man] You see, it worked out. -[woman] Baby.
[woman] I missed you.
[Tumi] This would have never happened on a flight to Mauritius.
translation.ja: モーリシャス島行きなら…

translation.en: I mean, it could have,
but at least I’d be going on a solocation to Mauritius, instead of--
translation.ja: 一人の休暇を過ごせたはず

translation.en: -[man] Jo'burg? -What?
Are you also spending your Christmas in Jo’burg?
Oh, yeah, um,
translation.ja: ええ 妹の結婚式を

translation.en: home. My sister’s getting married.
-[man cheers] -Oh, my gosh!
We’re getting married next year.
His family wants us to get married in Jo’burg and I'm like,
translation.ja: 彼の家族もヨハネスブルクがいいって

translation.en: nobody gets married in Joburg. It's been like--
translation.ja: 普通は誰も選ばないわ

translation.en: [man] Sorry, sister.
-Do you mind if…? She’s cold. -[Tumi] So?
She’s cold. So do you mind…
[Tumi] If I ever fall in love, shoot me.
translation.ja: 恋愛なんてクソ食らえ

translation.en: [man] You know we're in Jo'burg when the escalators aren't working.
translation.ja: せっかく到着しても エスカレーターは故障だ

translation.en: Oh, my goodness!
It's probably loadshedding.
I agree.
-[man] There we are. -But it's fine, we're here. We made it.
translation.ja: でも― とにかく着いた

translation.en: Yes. Yes.
-Selfie? Selfie, baby? -Of course!
translation.ja: じゃあ 自撮りしよ いい？ うん

translation.en: [Tumi] Are you fucking kidding me?
Wait, wait, wait baby. Let's do nosies.
-Nosies. -[woman] Nosies.
-[man] Did you get it? -Okay.
[man] Come, let's go.
[Khaya] Oh! You always knew how to make friends.
ORLANDO PIRATES SUCKS!
translation.ja: “オーランドサッカーチーム野郎”

translation.en: [Tumi] Really?
[Khaya] [in Xhosa] The truth hurts.
[Tumi] Yeah. Just like how guys who drive Porsches,
-are always trying to overcompensate. -No one's complaining.
translation.ja: 自分を過剰評価？ 不満はない

translation.en: You know, I really shouldn’t have invited you to this wedding.
translation.ja: 結婚式に呼ぶんじゃなかった

translation.en: -[in Xhosa] I will leave you here, try me. -[in Xhosa] You won't.
[in Zulu] I'm kidding!
[whooping] T-money, T-Gwap, T-cash, T-baby!
translation.ja: 〈だよな〉 〈俺のトゥミ 元気？〉

translation.en: -Whadda do, baby? -[Khaya] That's right!
[Tumi] Don’t make this awkward by saying something stupid like…
[Khaya] I missed this.
Come, let's take a picture for the gram.
-For the gram? -Yeah, yeah, yeah.
How else are people going to know that I'm happy to see you?
translation.ja: 君に会えて幸せな俺を投稿

translation.en: -Ah! I can see we're still obsessed. -Yeah, yeah, yeah.
[Khaya] Gotta give the people what they want.
[metro cop] Hello, Beyonce, Jay-Zed. You're here to make out?
translation.ja: 〈ビヨンセとジェイ･Ｚの２人〉 〈イチャついてるけど〉

translation.en: [in Zulu] Can't you see that this is for pickups only?
[in Zulu] If you want to kiss each other, go away.
[in Zulu] Or would you rather get a parking ticket?
-Oh, okay. No! No! -No! No! We're leaving.
-Lemme get the bags. -[in Zulu] Yes, leave.
[Refiloe] [in Xhosa] You look so beautiful!
-[Thando] Oh, my word! -Wow!
[Thando] You look absolutely amazing.
Looks like someone didn’t stick to the Team Bride diet.
translation.ja: 花嫁組のダイエットどうやらダメね

translation.en: [in Xhosa] Um, what diet? I am not going to eat my first meal at lunch time.
translation.ja: 〈何のこと？断食なんて無理よ〉

translation.en: December, babes.
[Thando] Guys, it's called intermediate fasting for a reason, I mean Refiloe.
translation.ja: “中断”ダイエットって言うのよ

translation.en: [in Xhosa] Please repeat that. Inter- what?
Intermediate fasting.
-[Refiloe in Xhosa] You and your English. -[Beauty] It's intermittent.
Listen, only poor people fast, okay? I'm not poor today.
translation.ja: 断食は貧乏者がするの 私は違う

translation.en: No, no, poor people actually don't fast. They're actually hungry.
translation.ja: 貧乏な人は断食しないわ ただ空腹なの

translation.en: Guys, we're going to be on national TV. Trust me it's gonna be worth it.
translation.ja: 国営テレビ局が入るのよ 頑張ってよ

translation.en: Am I-- Am I the only person who stuck to this diet?
translation.ja: ダイエットしたのは私だけ？

translation.en: [in Xhosa] Friend, as I said, it's the holidays!
translation.ja: だってクリスマス休暇よ

translation.en: Have a strawberry.
[in Xhosa] Take it to the top.
Okay, I'll see. Let me help you.
[Thando] Breathe in.
I'm gonna need you to… -Breathe in. Breathe in. -[sighs in relief]
[in Xhosa] How will you breathe, babe?
Uh, breathing is overrated.
Um, okay.
Um… Yeah, it's… It's not… her yet.
translation.ja: 困ったわまだ到着しないって

translation.en: I don't understand why Tumi didn't get here on time like the rest of us.
translation.ja: トゥミったらなぜ約束を守れないのかな

translation.en: Ah, guys, let’s try on the Zulu outfits.
-The Zulu outfits sound like a vibe. -Yes, yes, yes!
translation.ja: いいね そうしよう

translation.en: [Thando in Zulu] ♪ The bride is ours ♪
-♪ We all agree ♪ -[Refiloe] ♪ Say yeah ♪
♪ Knock, knock ♪
I can't believe my sister is getting married on Christmas day.
translation.ja: クリスマスに妹が結婚だなんて

translation.en: [in Xhosa] Yes, well, you don't go home anymore.
translation.ja: 〈だって君が帰って来ないから〉

translation.en: How else were they going to get you to come home for Christmas?
translation.ja: クリスマスに呼ぶ苦肉の策さ

translation.en: [sighs] Tell me one person who wants that.
[in Xhosa] Hello? Am I invisible?
-Aw, you're so cute. -What?
-You missed me. -No! No! Whatever. No.
translation.ja: 私が恋しかったの？ 違うよ　調子に乗るな

translation.en: I did not. Don’t flatter yourself. No I didn't.
translation.ja: 違うよ　調子に乗るな 全然違う

translation.en: It's… It's just that I can’t go home.
translation.ja: 俺は家に帰れないんだ

translation.en: [in Xhosa] My father will be there, and all he ever does is talk about mom,
translation.ja: 親父のせいだ ママの話ばかりになって

translation.en: and it makes him sad, Which makes everyone feel worse. So, yeah.
translation.ja: 悲しくなる 誰のためにもならない

translation.en: Well, good thing is, you get to be my date.
translation.ja: でも いいこともあるよ 私の彼氏役になって

translation.en: And save me from this three-day wedding saga.
translation.ja: 地獄の結婚式から救ってよ

translation.en: You know what, I am glad my family’s grief is working out for you.
translation.ja: 俺の悲しみが役立ってうれしいよ

translation.en: So I’m all set for the traditional wedding tomorrow,
translation.ja: 明日の伝統儀式は行くけど

translation.en: but I might be a bit late for the white wedding on Christmas Day.
translation.ja: クリスマス当日の― 結婚式には遅れるよ

translation.en: -Oh. -I've got a thing.
translation.ja: そんな 用事があるんだ

translation.en: Girls aren’t things, Khaya.
No, it’s not a girl.
[Tumi] It's always a girl with him.
Okay, fine, fine, you know what, I'll tell you if you don't make the sound.
translation.ja: 分かった　言うよ 音を立てるなよ

translation.en: -What sound? -You know what sound I'm talking about.
translation.ja: 何の音？ 例の音だよ

translation.en: [laughs] I'm not going to fall into this. Okay, you know what, fine, I'll tell you.
So on Christmas day, I dress up as Father Christmas
translation.ja: クリスマスに― 俺はサンタになる

translation.en: and I go to a local home and hand out presents to the kids.
translation.ja: 地元の子供にプレゼントを配るんだ

translation.en: -[retching sounds] -Oh, man!
Oh, you’re so predictable. I should have known.
translation.ja: やっぱり思った通りだ

translation.en: Oh, man, I walked right into that one. Okay, fine. Are you done?
translation.ja: 直球だな　もういい？

translation.en: -Are you done? -Yeah.
translation.ja: 直球だな　もういい？ うん

translation.en: Hey, look, you should come with me. No, come on. Come with me.
translation.ja: 君も一緒に来いよ　ぜひ来て

translation.en: Tumi, you should see these kids, their faces.
translation.ja: 君も子供達の顔を見れば

translation.en: They will melt your stone-cold, dead heart.
translation.ja: 凍りついた心が溶けるよ そう？

translation.en: -Yeah? -Yeah!
Will they melt it enough to help me with my maid of honor speech?
translation.ja: 溶かしてよ スピーチ言えるほど

translation.en: -Beauty trusted you to write something? -Right?
-You! -Yeah.
Wow!
I don’t even know what to say.
Help me?
-With what? -The speech.
-No! No! -Please.
No! No, don't even do that.
translation.ja: そんな顔してもダメだ

translation.en: Don't even look at me like that. I'm not helping you.
This is not second year. No!
You get to do your own homework. I'm not helping you.
-Come on. -I'm not!
-[big inhale] Look at that smile. -I'm not smiling.
That's the "I will help you" smile.
-I'm not smiling. [laughs] -Thank you in advance, man.
Whatever.
Okay!
-[in Xhosa] Hey! -Hi.
[in Tswana] Hello.
[Bokang] [in Tswana] Look at this line, does this line look straight to you?
Aha! Is there anything that's ever straight with you, darling?
translation.ja: あんたが偉そうに言える立場？

translation.en: [in Tswana] You finally decided to grace us your wretched-ass presence.
translation.ja: 〈結局 来たの？〉 イヤな奴

translation.en: Ah, Khaya. Still cute.
translation.ja: カイヤは いつも素敵

translation.en: [in Tswana] But you are still Xhosa.
Bokang. Still funny.
translation.ja: ボカンは変わらず愉快

translation.en: [Moipone] Boitumelo!
-[laughs] -[Tumi] [in Sotho] Aunty!
-[in Tswana] How are you? -[in Tswana] You finally found a man!
translation.ja: 〈元気？〉 〈やっと男を見つけのね〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] I thought we were going to have to slaughter a white chicken for you!
translation.ja: 〈お前の結婚式はもうないかと思った〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] No, this is my friend.
Khaya, this is my mother’s older sister.
-[in Xhosa] Aunty Moipone. -[in Xhosa] Aunt?
translation.ja: 〈モイポンおばちゃん〉 〈叔母ちゃん？〉

translation.en: [in Xhosa] I was already thinking about the bride price,
and how I would bring all the cows I have. [laughing]
[Tumi] And that's what we call the Khaya effect.
translation.ja: カイヤは いつもこう

translation.en: [Dineo] [in Tswana] Is Tumi going to come and greet me,
or is she going to keep hiding in the house?
Yeah, I got you. Mom.
translation.ja: 分かったママ　今行く

translation.en: Okay. [laughs]
-Hi, girl! -Hey!
[in Tswana] Is your friend angry?
Yo! But it's not as bad as last Christmas.
translation.ja: 去年のクリスマスよりマシ

translation.en: [in Tswana] What happened last Christmas?
[in Tswana] You would have known if you were here.
[Tumi] All you need to know about my relationship with my mother,
is that until I was twelve, I called my grandmother Mom
translation.ja: 私が12歳の時 祖母が母代わりで

translation.en: and my mother Big Sis, Dineo.
translation.ja: 母は姉になってたから

translation.en: Hi, ma.
[in Tswana] Please, don't ruin this for your sister.
translation.ja: 〈妹のためにぶち壊さないでね〉

translation.en: Oh, lovely to see you, mother.
-[in Tswana] Khaya. Is that you? -[in Xhosa] Yes, mom.
[Dineo] [in Xhosa] How is your family doing?
[in Xhosa] Yes, mom, they are well, thank you.
translation.ja: 〈はいありがとうございます〉

translation.en: Thank you.
[in Xhosa] Oh, this is aunt Grace.
She's the youngest of the four.
The youngest, the sexiest, the most gorgeous.
translation.ja: 最も若くセクシーで魅力的

translation.en: [Tumi] [in Xhosa] You go, girl.
Khaya, can you help me take these things to the car?
translation.ja: カイヤ 車に運ぶのを手伝って

translation.en: -Okay. -[in Tswana] No! He's too young for you.
[in Tswana] Well, I still would…
-[Grace] Tumi? -Mmm.
Please don’t kill each other before the wedding.
translation.ja: 式の前にケンカやめてね

translation.en: So, uh…
[in Tswana] What's with the Extreme Makeover Home Edition?
[Dineo] [in Tswana] When the Twalas arrive here tomorrow,
[in Tswana] they need to find everything perfect.
[in Tswana] Did you win the lottery?
[in Tswana] No. The bride price is used for such things.
translation.ja: 〈いや 新郎の持参金を使ったの〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] The bride price money? For renovating your house?
[in Tswana] What have you contributed?
[Tumi] And this is where I shut up.
[in Tswana] You know what?
[in Tswana] This wedding is very important, Tumi.
I wonder how your Jesus feels about Beauty hijacking His birthday?
translation.ja: イエスの誕生日をビューティが乗っ取る

translation.en: [in Tswana] My Jesus will be happy to see Beauty happy.
translation.ja: 〈イエス様も―〉 〈彼女を祝福してる〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] The fittings went very quickly I see.
[Tumi] Shit.
[in Tswana] You forgot about the fittings?
Yes. No!
[in Tswana] I just thought I would come by and greet you first.
translation.ja: 〈まずママにあいさつと思って〉

translation.en: And now that I’ve seen you…
Bye!
[Candice] Welcome, Minister Twala, Mrs. Twala.
translation.ja: トワラ大臣夫妻いらっしゃいませ

translation.en: [Vusi] Ah, thank you. Thank you. It's good to be here.
translation.ja: どうもありがとう着いたよ

translation.en: [sighs] Yeah.
[Valencia] Mm-mm! This isn’t champagne.
translation.ja: シャンパンじゃないわ

translation.en: It’s an excellent MCC.
-[Vusi] MCC? -[hesitant] Yes.
What kind of Mickey Mouse operation are you conducting here?
translation.ja: 何だ　子供だましか？

translation.en: This wedding is of national importance and is going to be televised.
translation.ja: この式は国家の一大事テレビ放映もある

translation.en: Do you know what Black Twitter is like? Do you want to make me a hash tag?
translation.ja: 悪評を書いてやる ハッシュタグ付きでな

translation.en: Please, don't.
[Lydia] [in Zulu] Oh, this place is so beautiful.
Maybe we should renew our wedding vows here.
[Sbu] Hey, Beauty will kill you if you hijack our wedding, okay.
translation.ja: 僕らの結婚式だビューティが怒る

translation.en: [Themba] [in Zulu] Okay. That won't happen, okay.
We’re all under enough pressure.
[in Zulu] Lydia, please don't.
Are those the non-alcoholic ones?
No.
You’re off to a great start.
[Vusi] So Mama, what do you think
of your grandson getting married in such a wonderful place?
translation.ja: こんな素敵な場所で孫が結婚式だ

translation.en: You’re very lucky.
The owners wouldn't ordinarily close down this place for a private function.
translation.ja: プライベート行事で貸切なんて 珍しいことです

translation.en: I guess that comes with the perks of being a minister of distinction.
translation.ja: 偉い大臣の特権だろうね

translation.en: [in Zulu] I can't believe that your father and I fought in the struggle
translation.ja: 〈お前が白人に金を渡すために―〉

translation.en: so that you could give your money to white people.
translation.ja: 〈父さんと働いたんじゃない〉

translation.en: [Sbu] [in Zulu] Granny.
What did she say?
She said that, um…
it's quite wonderful that we have the whole place to ourselves.
translation.ja: 全ホテルを使えて素晴らしいって

translation.en: So, are you going to show us our rooms, or are we're going to sleep here?
translation.ja: お部屋を見せてちょうだい ここで寝ないでしょ

translation.en: Of course, I’m sorry. Please come this way.
translation.ja: もちろんですどうぞ こちらへ

translation.en: [Themba] I can't believe this family booked the whole place for Sbu.
He doesn't even have that many friends.
translation.ja: スブは友達も多くないのに

translation.en: Is it weird that-- I don't know,
translation.ja: 奇妙だよな なぜかな

translation.en: [in Zulu] I’m a bit jealous that they did all of this for Sbu because,
translation.ja: 全部スブのためだうらやましい

translation.en: I mean, this is Four Seasons hot-- [in Zulu] Uh-huh! No, come on, again?
translation.ja: フォーシーズンズだよ 〈参ったな〉

translation.en: [in Zulu] No way! You always want to have sex.
translation.ja: 〈頼むよ〉 〈頭はセックスだけかよ〉

translation.en: Yes, I’m ovulating.
[moaning] Okay.
Actually, this needs me on my back, in missionary. It's better for conception.
translation.ja: それじゃあ どうぞ 正常位が妊娠しやすい

translation.en: [in Zulu] Do your thing, baby.
[in Zulu] The phone…
-What? -Honey.
Sbu.
Sbu…
[in Zulu] Hey, bro.
[in Zulu] We've arrived and everything is good.
Yeah.
[whispers] [in Zulu] He wants me to go to him.
[in Zulu] No, it's fine, I'm coming. I'll come to you.
Yeah, sharp!
Mm-mm! Baby, Sbu can wait.
Mm-mmm. But I need to--
[in Zulu] Look…
[in Zulu] I'm his brother and I'm the best man,
translation.ja: 〈俺は兄貴だし花婿付添人でもある〉

translation.en: -and you know how that can be. -Of course.
translation.ja: 分かってくれ 確かに

translation.en: -Maybe I should come and help you then. -No!
translation.ja: 私も行くわ いいよ

translation.en: No. No. No.
Look, you’re ovulating.
translation.ja: だって…　排卵期だろ

translation.en: So, now relax
[in Zulu] because you need to stay calm and "bake".
-Okay. -[Themba] [in Zulu] Just like a stove.
translation.ja: うん 〈ストーブみたいに〉

translation.en: Put these on.
For your swimmers to get more freedom.
[in Zulu] Right?
-To boost fertility. -[mumbles] Okay.
translation.ja: これは精力増強用よ うん

translation.en: Is this not an old wives’ tale?
Aren't wives usually right?
Aren’t I the most beautiful Zulu-Tswana bride you've ever seen?
translation.ja: ズールー族とツワナ族の― 最高の花嫁

translation.en: [Tumi] Ah, my sister. Always so modest.
Oh! Who could ever compare?
-[Tumi] Oh, look at you. -You're late.
[Thando] We thought your plane crashed and burned.
translation.ja: 飛行機が墜落したのかと

translation.en: Crashed?
Wow! You're going have to pray a little harder next time.
translation.ja: 次は もっと強く祈らなきゃ

translation.en: Khaya.
[Refiloe] Still looking like my future baby daddy.
translation.ja: 私の子供の父親になって

translation.en: [in Zulu] Hold up, Miss Loose Panty. That's my date.
We said no plus ones.
-But you're my sister. -Yes, and as my sister,
translation.ja: でも妹でしょ そうよ　姉として

translation.en: you should know better.
We don't have food for him. There's no space.
translation.ja: 食事は出せない　席もない

translation.en: [Tumi] And yet you booked out the Four Seasons.
translation.ja: フォーシーズンズでしょ？

translation.en: Okay, guys. If there's a problem then
translation.ja: いいよ 問題なら僕は遠慮する

translation.en: -[in Zulu] I don't have to come. -No!
translation.ja: 問題なら僕は遠慮する ダメよ

translation.en: He can’t spend Christmas by himself.
[pleading] Come on, B.
He has no mother.
Did you get me my wedding present?
Of course.
Tell her.
-I left it in Cape Town though. -Well, I could save you the trip.
translation.ja: 忘れてきた 別にいいけど

translation.en: You see Sbu and I weren’t going to have a honeymoon
translation.ja: 私たちハネムーンを断念

translation.en: because of the whole move to London
and how much that costs, you know the pound and stuff. So…
translation.ja: ポンドのレートが高くて

translation.en: So?
So, you can gift us your miles.
translation.ja: あなたのマイレージちょうだい

translation.en: No. No. No. My miles are for Mauritius.
translation.ja: ダメよモーリシャス島に行くのに

translation.en: Oh, we love Mauritius.
You know had you arrived on time,
translation.ja: 今日遅刻してなければ

translation.en: I could have found space for Khaya over here,
but now you’re gonna have to sit with Mom.
[Tumi] Well played, Beauty.
You know, I’ll give you my miles.
translation.ja: 分かった マイルを渡すよ

translation.en: -Sister, you don't have to do that. -Anything for you.
translation.ja: いいの？ 何でも言って

translation.en: [Beauty] Hurry up and get dressed, we have to leave for the next fitting.
translation.ja: 急いで着替えて次の試着よ

translation.en: [Themba] [in Zulu] You're getting married, man.
A new job overseas,
[in Zulu] you've done really well for yourself.
Yeah! From engaged to getting married in three months.
translation.ja: 偉いよ 婚約後３ヵ月で結婚

translation.en: Yeah, but you don't think I'm rushing this?
-No. -No?
translation.ja: 早過ぎたかな？ 全然 そう？

translation.en: -No. You-- -Yeah?
-You're fine. I mean unless you… -Yeah?
translation.ja: 大丈夫だ うん だって…

translation.en: [in Zulu] Did you get her pregnant?
[in Zulu] Are you getting married because she's pregnant?
Lydia will kill me if you had a kid first. You can't do that.
translation.ja: 先越されたらリディアに殺される

translation.en: -Come on! -We’re far from babies.
translation.ja: 違うよ 頼むよ 子供だなんて

translation.en: [in Zulu] You see with the London job, we couldn't wait to get married.
translation.ja: 急いだのはロンドンの仕事のため

translation.en: -Plus Beauty really liked this place. -It is really pretty.
translation.ja: ビューティは ここが好き

translation.en: -Might as well. -Yeah, sharp.
translation.ja: そうか だからさ 大丈夫だ

translation.en: I mean, your love will take you through anything.
translation.ja: 愛があれば何でも可能だ

translation.en: [in Zulu] You guys are okay.
-Sure. -Yeah.
Until like…
[in Zulu] You even pray to God and say,
[in Zulu] "Take me, Lord. Take me first and throw me away.
translation.ja: 〈“勘弁してくださいもう十分だ”〉

translation.en: [in Zulu] I'm done."
Well, I just hope your best man speech is better than that, right?
translation.ja: スピーチでもそれを言うの？

translation.en: -Yeah, no, I'm kidding. -Oh.
-[in Zulu] I'm joking. -[in Zulu] You're joking?
-Yeah. -[in Zulu] You're joking?
Yeah. Marriage is great.
-[in Zulu] I'm telling you. -Sure.
It's the best decision I've ever taken in my life.
-Sure? -Yeah.
[in Zulu] Great!
-Yeah. -Yeah.
-Sure? -Yeah.
-You look amazing! -[Tumi] [whispers] Fuck.
-You don't like it. -I love it.
It's so… breathtaking and stuff.
translation.ja: 何というか圧倒される感じね

translation.en: Also why do we need the three dresses?
Because it's three ceremonies.
-Did you not read anything on the group? -I did. It's just…
translation.ja: 聞いてない？ 聞いてるけど―

translation.en: in my mind,
[in Tswana] I didn't think we'd be galivanting around Jo'burg for fittings.
translation.ja: 〈試着のために呼ばれた気分よ〉

translation.en: Well, Tumi, had you arrived earlier,
we wouldn't have to squeeze everything into one day
-and maybe we wouldn't be behind schedule. -Chill, okay.
translation.ja: 遅れもなかった 落ちついて

translation.en: I'm sure Refiloe and Thando have things sorted at the venue.
Tumi, you're the maid of honor.
Yeah. [tongue click]
You look nice.
You mean amazing. Thank you.
translation.ja: でしょ ありがとう

translation.en: Baby, how long do you think we're going to take here?
translation.ja: ねえ いつまでここに足止め？

translation.en: [in Tswana] Poor Khaya. He's probably bored in the car.
-What's going on there? -Where?
You and Khaya.
Oh, come on. Are you guys done ignoring each other?
We weren’t. We were.
It’s been awkward for two years now.
I hope you know you’re not getting any younger.
-I would rather die happy. -You can’t be alone and happy.
translation.ja: 幸せに死にたい 一人じゃ無理

translation.en: How do you know? It's not like your family
is the poster for happy endings in relationships.
translation.ja: ハッピーエンドしてる？

translation.en: [in Tswana] For real, listen.
Aunt Moipone's husband died when she was young.
translation.ja: 〈おばのモイポンは夫が早死で〉

translation.en: Grace got dumped shortly after her bride price was agreed.
Your uncle is married to alcohol.
I don't even want to talk about your mother.
-You know, I’m pretty sure we’re cursed. -Don’t say that.
translation.ja: 呪われてる そんな

translation.en: Why? No, no, no, we are actually better off alone.
translation.ja: だから一人の方がいいのよ

translation.en: What if Mom didn't want to be alone?
translation.ja: ママは一人が嫌だったかも

translation.en: Dad made that decision for her.
Yeah.
What if he made a mistake?
Guys, can you give us a second?
[sighs] Tight.
Whose address is this?
[in Tswana] It's Dad's.
[in Tswana] I asked Aunt Grace to help me find him.
Just don’t tell Mom.
Come on, say something.
-Why now? -Because what kind of bride
translation.ja: なぜ今？ だって花嫁よ

translation.en: doesn’t have a father to walk her down the aisle?
He left you before you took your first steps.
translation.ja: 赤子の時に捨てられたのに

translation.en: -Okay, don’t you want to see him? -No! But actually, I...
translation.ja: 会いたくない？ 全然よ　パパなんて

translation.en: I don’t care about people who abandon me.
translation.ja: 私を捨てた人間に興味ない

translation.en: [in Tswana] Mom left me with Granny,
and you’ve seen what it’s like between me and her.
translation.ja: 私をおばあちゃんに預けた

translation.en: It just feels like something's missing.
You’re about to cement yourself as Mommy's favorite daughter
translation.ja: あなたはママのお気に入り

translation.en: and then marry the Black Prince Harry,
translation.ja: 黒人の貴公子と結婚だし

translation.en: and I'm gonna say something nice about you publicly at your reception.
translation.ja: 私は皆の前であなたのためにスピーチ

translation.en: Do you really need more than that?
Wow, Beauty. I'm good, I'm done.
translation.ja: ビューティ 私には許せない

translation.en: I can't.
Look, I can take you to Mauritius,
translation.ja: モーリシャス島に行こう

translation.en: but in return you're gonna have to be my personal insta photographer.
translation.ja: 俺のインスタ用の写真を撮って

translation.en: [in Tswana] Beauty is living in a fairytale,
or doesn’t think.
I have an idea.
We can maybe meet up later, I'll cook you dinner,
translation.ja: 僕が夕食作るから一緒に食べよう

translation.en: and you can use your sommelier skills to upgrade my wine collection.
translation.ja: 君のワイン講義を受けたい

translation.en: That sounds great, right?
And we can talk about whatever’s going on between you and your sister.
translation.ja: たくさん語ろうぜ 妹のことも

translation.en: [sigh] I don’t want to talk.
Then I’ll help you with your speech.
translation.ja: スピーチの手伝いもするから

translation.en: Look,
I’m glad that you called me.
translation.ja: 電話 うれしかった

translation.en: And that things aren’t awkward between us after…
translation.ja: あんなことがあったけどね

translation.en: everything that happened.
A free dinner sounds good.
Yeah!
translation.ja: うん ワイン講義は有料よ

translation.en: But you have to pay me to help you with your wine collection.
Oh, of course.
I’ll call you when I’m done.
Also, if you're gonna take me to Mauritius,
translation.ja: それから モーリシャス島では

translation.en: you're gonna have to pack a selfie stick.
translation.ja: 自撮り棒を使いなさい

translation.en: -[in Tswana] What? -They want me to put up the tent.
You’re an engineering student.
Look at God!
[in Tswana] I hope you're not taking the Lord's name in vain, Boitumelo?
translation.ja: 〈トゥミ 神様を簡単に口に出さないで〉

translation.en: Just praising Him because He’s so good. Hallelujah.
translation.ja: 良き神を称賛しているだけ

translation.en: [in Tswana] Amen.
[Shadrack] Ah, Boitumelo Sello!
translation.ja: 〈おや トゥミじゃないか〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] Did you bring me nice alcohol from Cape Town?
translation.ja: 〈ケープタウンの酒はあるな？〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] Hello, how are you?
[in Tswana] How are you? I'm fine.
[in Tswana] I'm kidding. You know,
you know I’ve got your back.
[Tumi] My uncle can drink anyone under the table
translation.ja: 叔父は誰より酒豪だけど

translation.en: and still be a fully functioning adult.
translation.ja: どれだけ飲んでも平気な人

translation.en: [in Tswana] All of you, I don't want you drinking.
[in Tswana] We need to concentrate and be focused.
[Gace] Then you wonder why
-[in Tswana] she doesn't come home. -Amen.
[Dineo] [in Tswana] You too, Grace.
[in Tswana] We need to prepare for tomorrow's gifting ceremony.
translation.ja: 〈明日の贈り物の儀式を準備しなきゃ〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] Bokang. Why are you just standing there?
-Tumi. -Ma.
[in Tswana] Where are the towels?
[Tumi] Oh, the towel sets for the gift giving ceremony tomorrow.
translation.ja: そうだ　明日の式に使うタオルセットね

translation.en: At least they would have been if I had remembered to buy them.
translation.ja: 買うように― 頼まれてたっけ？

translation.en: [in Tswana] Think it's best I bring them in the morning.
[in Tswana] Just before the Twalas arrive.
Uh-huh!
[in Tswana] I want everything packed tonight!
[in Tswana] I don't want Dineo saying I'm sabotaging her child's wedding.
translation.ja: 〈ディネオ家の結婚式だからね〉

translation.en: -[in Tswana] All right, let me-- -[in Tswana] She's right.
Shadrack.
[in Tswana] Make sure you fetch the meat.
[in Tswana] Don't worry yourself, Dini. I will bring back the best meat.
translation.ja: 〈ご心配なく〉 〈最高級の肉を持ってくる〉

translation.en: Succulent! Top class.
translation.ja: 〈最高級の肉を持ってくる〉 〈ジューシーな肉をね！〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] With this rope.
[in Tswana] An electric one?
[in Tswana] And you Grace, you're cooking with me at the venue.
translation.ja: 〈グレイスは―〉 〈私と式場で調理〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] No, what's the point of doing it at a venue then?
translation.ja: 〈なぜ式場で そんなこと〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] It means there's already catering.
[in Tswana] There's no need for us to cook.
[Dineo] [in Tswana] Grace, the Twala's paid for everything,
translation.ja: 〈全部トワラ家が払ったけど―〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] but they can't pay for good food.
translation.ja: 〈うまいものは金では買えない〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] Also, Grace makes the best potato salad.
translation.ja: 〈グレイスのポテトサラダは最高だ〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] That's the only thing she can make.
-[in Tswana] Oh, my goodness. -[in Tswana] Listen here.
[in Tswana] I don't want any mistakes for the next three days. No mistakes.
translation.ja: 〈式の３日間はミスが許されない〉 〈絶対に〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] No drama. Do you hear me, Shadrack?
translation.ja: 〈騒ぎは困るの　あなたも〉

translation.en: Yes.
[in Tswana] We're not you or your children, Dineo.
[in Tswana] Sister Moipone. What did you say about my kids?
[in Tswana] Please don't start with me.
-[in Tswana] I'm asking you. -[in Tswana] Wait a minute.
[in Tswana] Let's go.
[in Tswana] You must lock up Sister Moipone.
[in Tswana] The key is on the table.
-[in Tswana] Okay, I'm coming. -[in Tswana] Hurry up!
[Bokang] Mama won’t get it.
[Tumi] Who cares? Just come out to her.
[in Tswana] I'm not like you.
My mum actually likes me.
And Terrence? Is he going to "actually" like you,
translation.ja: テレンスは？ 〈電話でキャンセルしたら？〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] once I phone him and uninvite him?
[Bokang] [in Tswana] Let's get a move on.
Your mum can't find us here.
-Don't forget, we have a deal. -Okay.
translation.ja: いいね　約束だよ うん

translation.en: [in Tswana] I'll help you with the towels,
and you call Terrence and tell him that he can't come to the wedding.
translation.ja: テレンスは式に来ちゃダメ

translation.en: Why did you invite him in the first place?
[in Tswana] I didn't invite him!
He assumed he is invited.
translation.ja: 自分から来るって言った

translation.en: Wait, you got a plus one? Okay.
translation.ja: でもパートナーつきでしょ いいけど

translation.en: [whisper in Tswana] Okay, you must distract her,
-and I'll get the towels. Go in! -[gasp]
Hi.
-Oh, Precious. Baby girl! -[Precious] What's going on?
[in Tswana] Baby girl. So you know there’s a wedding, right?
translation.ja: 結婚式があるんだよね？

translation.en: [Dineo] [in Tswana] But Grace, why are you chopping such big pieces?
[in Tswana] This is the size you said you wanted.
[in Tswana] I didn't say that.
[in Tswana] Then you come and chop them.
[in Tswana] This is why men leave you.
[in Tswana] Oh! Where's your ring then?
[Dineo] [in Tswana] Me? At least I had a ring on my finger before.
[in Tswana] You on the other hand…
[in Tswana] Wow!
Mrs. Sello, as we discussed, you are welcome to cook here,
translation.ja: セロ様 お話しした通り大歓迎ですが

translation.en: even though we do have a Michelin star chef.
translation.ja: うちは星付きシェフもおります

translation.en: Can he make my mother’s mutton curry?
-Well, no, but-- -Then that's not good enough.
It’s just that we have an aesthetic here.
translation.ja: ここは美観を尊ぶ場所で

translation.en: And that aesthetic does not include three-legged pots sitting outside
translation.ja: 外にある３つの鍋は美観に合っていません

translation.en: for everyone to see.
Your aesthetic doesn’t accommodate Black people?
Yes!
I mean...
No! I mean…
[nervous inhale] You know what?
The pots are fine. I love them.
translation.ja: お鍋はいいです素敵です

translation.en: So authentic! [nervous chuckle]
Happy, happy cooking.
translation.ja: 幸せを呼ぶ料理ですね

translation.en: [whispers] Oh, God.
[in Tswana] I forget that you can be a boss sometimes.
[in Tswana] A Sello boss.
[in Tswana] Please go back to work, the fun is over.
-Sisters! Sisters! -[Grace laughs]
[in Tswana] The meat has arrived.
-[Grace laughs] Shadrack. -Oh, my goodness, Shadrack!
-[in Tswana] It's alive! -[in Tswana] Don't worry, Dini.
[in Tswana] I will slaughter it nicely.
translation.ja: 〈ちゃんと 調理するから〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] Plus your mutton curry will be so tender.
[in Tswana] It's an orphan. I got it for a discount.
-[in Tswana] Where's my change? -[in Tswana] I had to get a truck.
translation.ja: 〈お釣りは？〉 〈トラックを借りた〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] What about your crappy car?
[in Tswana] I didn't want to traumatize it. It's an orphan.
[in Tswana] With that piece of junk.
[in Tswana] Did you spend my money on alcohol?
-[in Tswana] Let me smell your breath. -[quick exhale]
[in Tswana] Again.
[Valenica] [in Zulu] I think she said the kitchen is this way.
translation.ja: 〈厨房(ちゅうぼう)は こっちのはず〉

translation.en: -[in Tswana] Kelebogile, come here. -[footsteps]
Hello, Valencia.
Dineo.
-[in Tswana] This is Grace. -Yeah, Grace.
[in Zulu] It looks like you need help in here.
[in Tswana] Yes, you can help chop over there.
Dineo doesn’t need our help with preparing tomorrow’s lunch.
translation.ja: ディネオたちだけで明日の昼食は大丈夫

translation.en: -[in Zulu] Isn't that right, Dineo? -[in Tswana] My team is ready.
translation.ja: 〈でしょ？〉 〈こっちはチームワークがあるわ〉

translation.en: [Valencia] Good for you.
You know having a personal chef has made me so lazy.
translation.ja: うちはシェフがいるからつい怠けちゃって

translation.en: Nice life problems.
Oh, well.
[in Zulu] What was that?
Family choir.
[in Zulu] We'll leave you ladies to it.
See you tomorrow, Valencia.
[in Tswana] Get that sheep out and make sure no one sees you, Shadrack.
translation.ja: 〈羊を隠してちょうだいシャドラック！〉

translation.en: -[in Tswana] Come help me, Grace. -[in Tswana] I'll come help you, Brother.
[in Tswana] Where are you going? You're not done cooking.
[in Tswana] Grace, let's go!
[in Tswana] My pots are burning.
-[Grace] Shadrack! -[Dineo] Grace!
[Vusi] Hallelujah!
We're about to die of hunger.
-[Lydia] Themba. -Okay.
translation.ja: テンバ お願い 了解

translation.en: [Valencia] [in Zulu] Thank you, my boy.
Sbu, how did your wedding prep issues go?
translation.ja: スブ 準備は大丈夫？

translation.en: What wedding prep issues?
[in Zulu] She's talking about
the one-on-one. The brotherly mentorship thing.
[Sbu] Oh, yeah. Yes.
Themba, you know that my ovulation window is small.
translation.ja: テンバ 私の排卵期は短いの

translation.en: [in Zulu] I'm sorry.
It’s these hormone injections that I'm taking.
translation.ja: 私が受けてるホルモン注射の話よ

translation.en: Injections?
[Sbu] [in Zulu] Yes, Grandma, so that she can fall pregnant.
[in Zulu] Why don't you just screw? That's the way to get pregnant.
[in Zulu] Grandma, it's actually a long story.
translation.ja: 〈おばあちゃん込み入った話なんだ〉

translation.en: [Vusi] [clears throat] Here’s to giving South Africa
an extravaganza that will trend for hours.
translation.ja: そして何時間も続く豪華なショーに！

translation.en: [Sbu] [in Zulu] I don't know why I agreed to a camera crew.
translation.ja: 〈なぜテレビカメラを許可したの〉

translation.en: Can’t it just be interviews?
Sbu, I didn’t pay all this money to book out The Four Seasons,
translation.ja: スブ ちっぽけな会見などのために

translation.en: just so we could do more interviews.
[in Zulu] Could you learn to just be a little grateful, my child?
translation.ja: 〈お父様に敬意を示しなさい〉

translation.en: I mean, you sprung this on us so fast, Sbusiso.
I understand. It's just that
I didn't want you guys to turn this into a political party conference.
translation.ja: 政治ショーにしてほしくない

translation.en: [in Zulu] You see I just wanted something small. Nothing major.
Sbusiso.
Look at Themba and Lydia. They had a big wedding
translation.ja: テンバたちも盛大な結婚式だった

translation.en: and look how happy they are.
[in Zulu] But they are not screwing.
[in Tswana] Aunt, here you go.
The towel sets are ready
[in Tswana] for the Twala Aunties.
Ah, good girl!
[Thando] Why did you bring them all the way here from the house?
translation.ja: でもなぜ わざわざ持って来たの？

translation.en: [Tumi] If this girl winds up dead, just know I did it.
translation.ja: 殺してやりたいほどイヤな女

translation.en: [in Tswana] I've said this before,
I don’t want to be blamed for sabotaging [in Tswana] my sister's wedding.
-Just give them to me and I'll put them-- -[in Tswana] No, it's okay. I've got them.
translation.ja: じゃあ 貸してよ 〈結構よ私が持ってるから〉

translation.en: [Moipone] [in Tswana] Give them to Thando. She knows where to put them.
[Thando] Babe, sorry. Did you get these from the hotel?
translation.ja: でもこれって… ホテルの？

translation.en: [Tumi] In retrospect, this was a geniously bad idea.
No.
No, but this is the hotel’s monogram.
[Refiloe] No, friend, maybe,
maybe the venue buys the towels from the same shop as her. Duh!
translation.ja: ホテルが同じ店で買ってるんじゃない？

translation.en: [Tumi] Dear sweet Refiloe.
translation.ja: 助けになってないってば

translation.en: You were going to give my in-laws
stolen towels from the hotel they paid for?
[in Tswana] Bokang, do you also steal now?
[in Tswana] She did this all on her own.
No, I was going to go buy towels in the morning.
translation.ja: 私は朝買いに行くつもりで

translation.en: These are just, you know, for now.
[in Tswana] Do you know what?
[in Tswana] I have a friend who can help us by opening her shop early.
translation.ja: 〈朝から開いてる友達の店に―〉

translation.en: -She sells this type of stuff-- -Relax, okay?
-They’re just towels. -Yep.
[in Tswana] These towels are for the welcoming ceremony.
translation.ja: 〈これはね―〉 〈儀式のための品だ〉

translation.en: [Tumi] At least I’m catching heat from my aunt and not my mother.
translation.ja: 結局 母ではなく叔母とトラブル

translation.en: Yes, ma'am.
[in Tswana] Maybe you should hear this from your mother.
Mama…
Grace,
[in Tswana] do you see this sheep?
[in Tswana] I gave it a name.
[in Tswana] Her name is succulent.
[in Tswana] Dineo is crazy. We are going to eat it.
[in Tswana] Yes, we are going to eat it.
[in Tswana] She'll tell everybody it's the best mutton curry she's ever made.
translation.ja: 〈きっと皆に言って回るよ〉 “今までで最高の羊カレーだ”ってね

translation.en: -[in Tswana] You know her. -[in Tswana] She's ridiculous.
[in Tswana] She and her sister, Moipone, are in the same WhatsApp group.
translation.ja: 〈モイポンとチャットしてるんだが〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] They talk too much.
[in Tswana] Yes, all the time you just hear her shouting "Grace!"
Shadrack!
[Dineo] Grace! Shadrack!
[Dineo] Emergency!
[Tumi] [in Tswana] You're all overreacting.
[shouting] These are just towels!
translation.ja: 〈皆 大げさだよ！〉 〈タオルじゃん！〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] Boitumelo, you like to provoke people.
[Shadrack] [in Tswana] So the emergency is about towels?
[in Tswana] With respect, I could list all your faults,
translation.ja: 〈もうウンザリ〉 〈ママも欠点ばかり〉

translation.en: but we would be here for a while.
[in Tswana] Don't talk to me like that.
[in Tswana] What else must I do?
[in Tswana] Tumi, my in-laws are going to hear you.
That’s all you care about?
Yes, this is my wedding.
[sighs] I don’t need this. You know, if I’m such a problem,
translation.ja: もういい 私が問題なら

translation.en: -then have this wedding without me. -Ohh my goodness!
translation.ja: 私なしでやって 〈まったく〉

translation.en: -[Dineo] Tumi. -[Tumi] [scoffs]
[in Tswana] What's really going on?
[in Tswana] So, seriously, the emergency was the towels?
[stammering] Sorry, Ma.
I hope you’re not on your way to see Sbusiso. It’s bad luck.
translation.ja: スブに会ったら縁起が悪いわよ

translation.en: No… no, um…
the decorations…
You know, Mom, I'm so happy to be marrying Sbu.
translation.ja: スブと結婚できて本当に幸せです

translation.en: Of course. You’ll never have to work again.
translation.ja: 働かなくて済むものね

translation.en: Oh, I wasn’t talking about money.
Don’t pretend. It's just the two of us here.
translation.ja: ここだけの話だからいいでしょ

translation.en: [in Zulu] Go to bed, Beauty.
You don’t want those dark circles
around your eyes tomorrow in your pictures, right?
[whispers in Zulu] You'll look ugly.
-Hi. -It's bad luck.
Okay, okay. What's wrong?
-Everyone’s ruining my wedding. -You want me to go deal with them?
translation.ja: 結婚式が台なし 僕が話す？

translation.en: -Yeah. -Yeah?
No. [sniffs]
It'll just make things worse.
-Let’s just go sign at Home Affairs. -No.
translation.ja: 家庭相談所は？ いいえ

translation.en: I’m not cancelling my dream wedding just because you’re cheap.
translation.ja: あなたがケチでも結婚はする

translation.en: Cheap? Cheap?
-It's bad luck. -Okay, okay.
Do you know how much a London flat costs?
translation.ja: ロンドンの家は いくらだ？

translation.en: And only God knows why you selected a two bedroom.
It's for our future babies.
Yeah, but we’re far away from that. I mean, thank God, right?
translation.ja: 子作りはまだ早いと思うよ

translation.en: -What? -Nothing.
[whispers] Can I get married without my mother and sister fighting?
translation.ja: 姉と母の争いをとめたい

translation.en: -Do you want us to wait for them to stop? -No.
translation.ja: それまで待つ？ まさか

translation.en: The next available date for this venue is in 2022
translation.ja: 次の式場の空きは2022年よ

translation.en: and that’s not enough time for those two.
Well,
I think I know how to make you feel better.
translation.ja: 僕なら君を慰められる

translation.en: -Come here. Come here. -[moans]
Come here.
-Not until after the wedding. -Shh.
translation.ja: 式が終わるまではダメ

translation.en: No, baby. It's bad luck.
translation.ja: ダメよ　縁起が悪い

translation.en: You sound like my mom.
-Nope. -I’m joking! I'm joking, it was a joke.
translation.ja: やめて 冗談だってば

translation.en: [Themba] Hey.
Hey.
[Tumi] [in Tswana] What's up?
[in Zulu] Where's your wife?
[in Zulu] The wife is sleeping.
She's fast asleep.
I'm just feeling a bit restless, [in Zulu] you know. And you?
translation.ja: 〈何だか落ち着かなくて君は？〉

translation.en: I quit the wedding.
What?
-I didn’t know you could do that. -[in Zulu] I'm the queen of the game.
translation.ja: そんなのあり？ 〈ゲームの女王よ〉

translation.en: [in Zulu] Look, I even stole their wine.
No, thank you.
Good choice.
This stuff tastes like pee.
[in Zulu] Let me have a look.
I know this wine. This wine's supposed to be really good,
translation.ja: これか うまいはずだ

translation.en: but you're the expert.
[Tumi] Reputation doesn’t mean good taste.
You should take in the nose of the wine.
Tell me, what do you smell?
Alcohol?
-[in Zulu] Oh! Zulu boys. -[in Zulu] Whatever.
You should be able to scent it’s spices, you know,
translation.ja: この風味 分からない？

translation.en: and the wood from where the barrel's from.
See, the scent of a wine can tell you its life story.
translation.ja: ワインの香りで― 物語が分かるのよ

translation.en: But in your case, this one is free. So, have some.
translation.ja: とにかく タダだし飲もう

translation.en: No, I'm fine. Thank you.
Oh, come on! It's one drink, it's not going to hurt you.
translation.ja: 一杯ぐらい 大丈夫よ

translation.en: I want to be clear-headed for tomorrow, I want to be focused.
translation.ja: 明日はテレビに映るから酔えないよ

translation.en: -And so should you. -[Tumi] No, no, no!
See, I'm fine right here in wine land.
See, here I don’t feel so alone
and I'm not judged for every mistake that I make.
translation.ja: 過ちを責められることもない

translation.en: Sounds nice.
Yeah, it is.
Just…
one night of being free.
[in Zulu] And wine doesn't judge.
[in Zulu] Take it.
-[in Zulu] "Take it." -[in Zulu] You're annoying.
[Themba] Okay.
Not to bad.
[in Zulu] Wait, walk properly.
-[in Zulu] I am walking properly. -[indistinct speech]
translation.ja: 〈ちゃんと歩いてるよ〉 〈何だっけ〉

translation.en: [together] ♪ You're gonna burn out ♪
♪ All my love ♪
-I feel so alive, man. -[Tumi] Yup.
translation.ja: 生きてると実感する でしょ

translation.en: I could do anything.
translation.ja: 何でも できそうだ

translation.en: -[shouting] I can do anything! -Themba, you're the man!
translation.ja: 何でも できる！ いいぞ！

translation.en: [Themba] ♪ I've been watching you ♪
Okay.
Let’s go swimming!
-Do you even know how to swim? -No!
translation.ja: 泳げるの？ 泳げない！

translation.en: [Khaya] Hey, where you at?
I thought we had plans.
I guess Beauty must be working you really hard, huh?
Call me when you get this.
♪ They've taken my wife ♪
[Vusi] I’m sure Themba’s fine and there’s no need for this hullabaloo.
translation.ja: テンバは大丈夫だよ大騒ぎしなくていい

translation.en: [Lydia] He’s still not answering his phone.
-[Sbu] He must be somewhere around here. -I’m going to look for him.
translation.ja: どこか近くにいるよ 見てくるわ

translation.en: [Valencia] [in Zulu] Oh, no.
[in Zulu] I'm not going to allow that child's paranoia to annoy our guests.
translation.ja: 〈あの子 許せない〉 〈大迷惑よ〉

translation.en: -[Vusi] Sbu. -Yes.
Which one do you think is gonna work better for the camera?
translation.ja: どっちがカメラ映えするかな？

translation.en: [Lydia] [in Zulu] Hello, may I please ask
-has anyone seen my husband around? -[Dineo] Any problem?
translation.ja: 夫を見てない？ 何か？

translation.en: No. No problem.
translation.ja: いいえ　何でもない

translation.en: [in Tswana] What's going on?
Let me go and check.
[in Tswana] Go, finish up. I'm just happy that this drama doesn't involve us
[in Zulu] and Shadrack got rid of the sheep.
translation.ja: 〈シャドラックの羊を煮よう〉

translation.en: -About that… -Uh-huh.
[in Tswana] You and Shadrack.
[in Tswana] Sister.
[Grace] [in Tswana] Don't leave me.
[in Tswana] He wanted to slaughter it, but he was too drunk. I took him home,
translation.ja: 〈羊の解体のはずが〉 〈彼が飲みすぎちゃって〉

translation.en: [in Tswana] but I couldn't load the sheep into the van on my own.
[in Tswana] The two of you had one job and you failed.
-[in Tswana] Oh, my goodness. -[in Tswana] So where's the sheep?
[in Tswana] It was tied here, Sister.
-[in Tswana] Do you see a sheep here? -[in Tswana] Oh, my goodness, Sister.
[in Tswana] You see Candice and the Twalas.
[in Tswana] They can't find it before we do.
[in Tswana] There's the Twala family.
[Dineo] [in Tswana] Let's go.
-[Dineo] Are you still looking for Themba? -[Vusi] Unfortunately so.
translation.ja: まだテンバ探し？ そうなんだ

translation.en: -[in Zulu] Lydia, try calling him again. -Okay.
[in Tswana] Let me go check that side.
[Lydia] Tumi? Why do you have Themba’s phone?
[Tumi] Oh, fuck.
-It's just, um… -[sheep bleats]
-[whispers] Tumi! -Where is my husband?
translation.ja: トゥミ！ 夫は どこ？

translation.en: Why are his underpants floating in the pool?
That’s not what it looks like. Um…
Was he drinking?
[Tumi] A shit load. A little.
-We have to call the police. -No, no, no.
[Dineo] [in Tswana] Boitumelo, what were you doing?
-[in Tswana] What did you do? -[Vusi] We're not calling the police.
translation.ja: 警察は呼ぶな 頼むよ

translation.en: What if those media vultures find out? No police.
-[in Zulu] She's starting again. -Wait a minute. What's the fuss all about?
Themba’s a recovering alcoholic.
Yo!
[Tumi] That explains a lot.
[Vusi] Yes and the last time Themba drank,
he ended up in Mozambique without a passport.
translation.ja: 旅券なしでモザンビークにいた

translation.en: He caused me a diplomatic incident of note and tainted my image.
translation.ja: 外交問題になって私の評判がガタ落ちだ

translation.en: We’ll find him before he gets to Mozambique.
translation.ja: その前に見つけるから

translation.en: [in Zulu] Look. What's this?
[in Zulu] What is this?
[Lydia] I'm going to kill you!
-[Sbu] No, no, no. -No, wait! Wait!
[Grace] Just jump! Come here!
-[Tumi] How? -Come here.
-[talking over each other] -[Vusi] Please!
[Lydia] Get out of my way.
-[in Zulu] This wedding is off. -[Sbu] Huh-uh, Mum--
-Peasant! -[Vusi] Val… Valencia.
translation.ja: 田舎者が！ おい　バレンシア

translation.en: Tumi, what’s going on?
[Tumi] I told you it wasn’t what it looked like.
[Beauty] Tumi!
-[Tumi] It's worse. -[sheep bleats]
Subtitle translated by: Rolé Swiegers
translation.ja: 日本語字幕　長野 孝子
